intro: Lobelia irasuensis subsp. picta, commonly known as the painted lobelia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its finely veined leaves and showy inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
